quote: A gravel bike is strongly recommended. These bikes are built for mixed terrain, including dirt, gravel, and mud. They have wider tires and strong frames that can handle the bumps and potholes.

From the friendly volunteers to the supportive fellow riders, everyone's there to enjoy the ride and help each other out. People encourage each other, stop to help with mechanical issues, and share snacks and stories after the race.
Q-It Up will be serving BBQ as part of your race entry for lunch. Ron's Beans Coffee, Goshen Brewing Company beverages & bottled water will also be part of your race entry.
This race will be timed as a gun start. Chips are used for timing.
It's one of the first big gravel races of the year in the region, which means it often sets the tone for the rest of the biking season.
Just a short drive from major cities like Chicago, Detroit, and Indianapolis, making it accessible for cyclists across the Midwest and beyond.
